titleStmt.author: Donne, George

analytic.title: On his great Duke of Florence; To Mr. PHILIP MASSINGER, my much esteemed friend.

monogr.title: The great Duke of Florence : A comicall historie. As it hath beene often presented with good allowance by her Maties Servants at the Phœnix in Drurie Lane. Written by Philip Massinger
monogr.author: Massinger, Philip

div.head: On his great Duke of Florence; To Mr. PHILIP MASSINGER, my much esteemed friend.

lg.l: ENjoy thy Lawrell! 'tis a noble choice,
Not by the suffrages of voice
Procur'd; but by a conquest so atchiev'd
As that thou hast at full reliev'd
Wither'd into a dulnesse of Despaire,
Vnto a former industrie) made knowne
This Work, which thou may'st call thine owne,
So rich in worth, that th'ignorant may grudge
To finde true vertue is become their Iudge.
